verses.text: 審判萬國「看哪！到了那些日子，在那個時期，我使猶大和耶路撒冷被擄的人歸回，

words.note: Refers to all the gentile nations.
Often used to draw attention to a significant statement.
Refers to the people/kingdom of Judah.

verses.text: 我必招聚列國，領他們下到約沙法谷，為了我的子民，就是我的產業以色列，我要在那裡親臨審判他們，因為他們把我的子民分散在列國中，又分取了我的地土。

words.note: Refers to God's chosen people or land.

verses.text: 他們為我的子民抽籤，用男童交換妓女，女童被賣換酒喝。
「推羅、西頓和非利士四境的人哪！你們想對我作甚麼呢？你們想向我報復嗎？你們若向我報復，我很快就使報應歸在你們的頭上。

words.note: Refers to the region and its people, the Philistines.

verses.text: 你們拿去了我的金銀，又把我的珍寶帶進了你們的廟宇。

words.note: Refers to a place of worship, often pagan in biblical contexts.

verses.text: 你們把猶大人和耶路撒冷人賣給希臘人，使他們遠離自己的境界。

words.note: Indicates the following noun is affected by the verb.

words.definition: to be far from, to stay away

verses.text: 看哪！我要激動他們離開被你們賣到的地方，我也要使報應歸到你們的頭上。

words.definition: to return to, to fall upon

verses.text: 我必把你們的兒女賣在猶大人的手中，猶大人必把他們賣給遠方示巴國的人，因為這是耶和華說的。」

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from the preceding verb, 'what was said'.

verses.text: 你們要在列國中宣告以下這話：「你們要預備爭戰，要激動勇士。讓所有的戰士都近前來，讓他們都上去攻擊。

words.note: Refers to multiple nations, often gentile nations in biblical context.

verses.text: 要把犁頭打成刀劍，把鐮刀打成矛槍；軟弱的要說：『我是勇士。』

words.definition: to forge into, to beat into
to forge into, to beat into

words.note: Refers to pole weapons like spears in ancient contexts.
Forms a noun phrase from the preceding adjective, 'the one who is weak'.

verses.text: 四圍的列國啊！你們快來幫助，在那裡一同聚集。耶和華啊！求你叫你的勇士下來吧。

words.note: Often used in biblical contexts referring to gentile nations.
The Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 在約沙法谷審判萬民「萬國都當奮起，上到約沙法谷去。因為我必坐在那裡，審判四圍的列國。

words.note: A valley mentioned in the Bible as a place of judgment.
Often used in biblical contexts referring to all people/nations.
Similar to 列國, often used in biblical contexts referring to gentile nations.

verses.text: 你們要伸出鐮刀，因為莊稼已經熟了。來踐踏吧，因為壓酒池滿了，酒池盈溢，因為他們的罪惡極大。

words.note: A basin where grapes are pressed to extract juice.
A basin where grapes are pressed to extract juice.
Often carries a strong theological meaning of 'sin'.

verses.text: 無數的人群齊集在判決谷，因為耶和華的日子臨近了判決谷。

words.note: A symbolic location for God's final judgment.
The Hebrew name for God.
A symbolic location for God's final judgment.

verses.text: 日月昏暗，星星無光。

words.note: Reduplication for emphasis or plural meaning.

verses.text: 耶和華從錫安吼叫，並從耶路撒冷發聲，天地就震動。耶和華卻要作他子民的避難所，作以色列眾子的保障。

words.note: Refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 你們知道我是耶和華你們的 神，是住在錫安我的聖山上。那時，耶路撒冷必成為聖。外族人必不得從其中經過。

words.note: The space before 神 (God) is a traditional reverence marker in Chinese Bibles.
Used as a postposition indicating location.

verses.text: 到那日，大山都必滴下甜酒，小山都必流出奶，猶大的一切溪流，都必水流不息。必有泉源從耶和華的殿裡流出來，灌溉什亭谷。

words.note: An idiom describing continuous flow.
Used as a postposition indicating 'inside'.

verses.text: 埃及將會荒涼，以東必變成淒涼的曠野，都因為他們向猶大人所行的強暴，又因為在他們的國中流了無辜人血。

words.note: Indicates future tense.
A grammatical construction forming a nominalized verb phrase.

verses.text: 猶大必永存「但猶大必存到永遠，耶路撒冷也必存到萬代。
現在我要追討我還未有追討的流人血的罪。耶和華在錫安居住。」

words.note: Indicates intention or future action.
Often used in contexts of divine judgment or seeking repayment for wrongs.
More formal than '沒有'.
Often used in contexts of divine judgment or seeking repayment for wrongs.
Connects a descriptive clause to a noun.
Connects an attribute or possessor to a noun.
In a religious context, refers to moral transgression against God.
The name of God in the Old Testament.
A historic hill in Jerusalem, often symbolic of the city or God's dwelling.
